caption: I visited while I was in for the month studying. I don't even have words for what a great experience I had. One of the best messages I've had the pleasure of being in for. If you're a student, this is absolutely worth the trek and worth your time.  It's also a beautiful building.

Wonderful place. Two worships for English speakers on Sundays. 11 am (classical) and 2 pm (contemporary). You can share tea, coffee and biscuits with the community and make acquaintance. The pastors are very welcoming. Their way of preaching is a soul relief. Some events are often organized so people can meet each other. I strongly advise to homesick expats to visit this place as often as possible.
It is very beautiful, big and of course relaxing. People with different nationalities but with a common language pray together I was very happy to be here.
The most beautiful American church. As a photographer I had the privilege of photographing here. The interior is gorgeous and the people who work here are very nice.

I am a Korean who visited the church in the evening on January 5th. Thank you so much for kindly opening the door even though we are strangers and welcoming us with a bright smile even though you are busy. The World Love Church I attend is 153, Garak-ro, Songpa-gu, Seoul. Our church made a Bible room escape experience from children to teenagers, and it was a church in all parts of Korea that had a room escape experience for Sunday school children. We are praying for a room escape experience with EU missionary work. I'm leaving for Korea today. Thank you for seeing the pastor. I pray for American Church in Paris.
Very welcoming church with a traditional service at 10am and a contemporary worship service at 2pm. Have been coming here for 5 months and seems like a great community to get connected to.

Hypocrisy at the highest level. Not allowed in at all. Is it even ‚Äòa house of prayer for all peoples?‚Äô When do you see a guard standing in front of the door to stop people from entering a church? Voil√†!

Welcoming church that renews our faith in humanity. Their Christmas Eve candlelight service is a special way to get into the true meaning of the holidays, regardless of religion or not. This is a place of compassion, connection and meaningful music (with huge thanks to the choir director Fred). Through the winters, their spaces are converted to host refugees, and a revolving team of volunteers give generously their time and resources to make sure each is well attended to, and have all necessary resources and supplies.
Beautiful church. Don‚Äôt miss this gem. Will hope to marry here one day üôè ‚Ä¶
I was visiting Paris for work and needed a place to worship. This congregation made me, a Presbyterian from New England, feel right at home. Sermon was excellent. I felt very welcome.

This church is amazing! The Texas boys choir and the Paris Boys choir performed here and it was perfection! I would definitely recommend coming here, it is incredibly silent when there‚Äôs no concerts or devices of course.
Lovely church with large halls & amazing organ.
Attended a wedding here and it's beautiful!
Relaxing place, nice architecture and helps to pray. It seems quite bigger than the part we can visit on opening hours.

I stayed at the American Church of Paris the last 2 wks of April 2022. My sister and brother in law were visiting pastors.  The church and faculty were amazing.  From the incredible stained glass to the remarkable organ the Church has a timeless charm that is overwhelming.  It's soul has such depth and its feels like coming home. Such a uplifting experience while among the most beautiful historic city in the world!!

This church reminds me of my church from home and I am a member here. The congregation and preachers are very friendly and welcoming! If you are visiting paris for the weekend and want to attend, it‚Äôs very warm and friendly to walk right in! Just a note, strollers are not allowed in the sanctuary; so make sure to plan accordingly!
Great church, great choir

Looking at Google maps, I remembered that I visited this lovely church with a school choir from Melbourne, Australia in June or July 2018.  We were made so welcome and enjoyed our brief visit immensely. Lovely acoustics to sing in and lovely people.
Beautiful Christmas Eve service! The music was lovely, and the sermon was so special.

This is my church, and we are actually only 10% Americans and a truly multinational group of people that come together in our love of God. There are three services, each a bit different from the others. My favorite is the 13h30 service which has a live band for modern Christian music that I especially like. I have met and volunteered with some of the most remarkable people, with beautiful hearts. I am honored to be a part and share time with them. Come join us and see what you think. üòä
Beautiful place

The American Church is a wonderful place in Paris. They‚Äôre long standing bulletin board is still there and how I found my apartment. They offered free coral concerts monthly and a variety of activities. A wonderful place to worship or build a community within Paris.
We went to the 9 AM service. It was awesome. Everybody was so kind and friendly. It was awesome to witness God‚Äôs love in another country.  Beautiful sanctuary.  Great sermon.

Beautiful building set on the banks of the Seine  not far from the Eiffel Tower. There is always something fun or educational going on there. There are frequent musical events too. Can't wait to get back to Paris and go back there.
Nice cathedral. Easily accessible on bus 63.
A beautiful church with lovely concerts to attend on some evenings. Bring a fan if you go in summer--it's hot!
Very excellent and friendly, the experience there is breathtaking, I felt the holy spirit. The teachings are about God and society, and how we treat our fellowmen in today's world.

They stopped having the 9an worship service that had communion evry Sunday and that's a real.shame. it was a low key service with few people attending but the people that came they really came to worship, not for the big music and coffee hour of the 11am one. Why did they stop a service where the risk of catching covid was soow? That doesn't make sense.

Last 13th November 2022 I've been there While I walked from my hotel to the tour Eiffel. I was very thirsty. I asked for WATER there. The doorman said that if I was not there enrolled for the mass I coudld not come in . THIS is the Christianity they preach there?
Great reformed English speaking worship 9 & 11am and 1:30 contemporary services. Thoughtful and soulful integrated theme, amazing music and engaging for everyone!
International welcoming family of Christian 'and other faith walks. Wonderful worship service and modern day humanitarian focus. A joyful place to commune in fellowship

Employees of this church are guilty of theft. An employee booked a massage with me, while agreeing with the cancellation policy. However, he cancelled the massage an hour before the appointment and hasn‚Äôt reacted to any of our requests to settle the bill. Attempts to contact him have had no effect, thus making us conclude that he has no intention to settle this affair. I have always understood that one of the Ten Commandments was ‚ÄòThou Shalt not Steal‚Äô. For the American Church in Paris this is obviously not the case, so watch your purse when you wander in here üò°
An international church, diverse and friendly.
Great mix of people from many different countries. Very welcoming church. Great for long-term or for visiting.
I went to an AA meeting there years ago whilst visiting Paris. Beautiful church

It is my Christian family. I be part of this church as member. It is the kingdom of heaven's embassy. The house of the Lord where people from all the world find a dwelling place to rest. Thanks be to God for this community.
A great place to worship and fellowship.  Warm staff, pastor open and friendly, excellent worship team.
The only place witch makes me feel secure, confidence, blessings with a grace full of happiness and unconditional love ‚ù§Ô∏èüíéüôè ‚Ä¶
